result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Jon Schouten

records.addlTxt: Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. NG. Attorneys would like to set a plea hearing. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 9:38 am.

9:32 AM Michael Jon Schouten appears in Court,  Atty Travis Satorius, ADA Kaley Walker for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Satorius states this will be a waiver. Court questions DE, he would like to waive the PH. Court finds DE freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed a felony. Court binds DE over for further proceedings.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.
filed by ADA Kaley Walker. eif

1:46 PM Michael Jon Schouten appears in Court,  Atty Travis Satorius appears via zoom, ADA Kaley Walker appears via zoom for the State of Wisconsin. Attorneys state a PH needs to be set. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 1:51 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Status conference on August 22, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

10:30 AM Defendant Michael Jon Schouten appears in Court, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. DE has not contacted the PD's office to see if he qualifies. ADA Walker states DE did not qualify for PD but should contact them to verify and pick up a PFAC. Court will reset. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 10:35 am.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant must report to the Pierce County Day Report Center today for fingerprints and photograph.
Defendant to maintain Absolute Sobriety.

9:42 AM Defendant Michael Jon Schouten appears in Court, DA Halle E. Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. DA Hatch is requesting a $10,000.00 SIBS w/conditions of AS, no objection. Court so orders. Court adjourned at 9:45 am.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Initial appearance on June 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:45 AM Defendant Michael Jon Schouten does not appear in Court, ADA Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Walker states DE had requested a continuance from May and now is requesting another continuance. State will object to another continuance and will reset.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Notice of not guilty plea and demand for trial by a twelve person jury filed by Michael J Schouten
